items.title: Liberal election autopsy delayed after Dutton suggests report defamatory
items.description: The report, co-authored by Liberal grandees Pru Goward and Nick Minchin, has now been sent to a legal team to ensure it is watertight while the party decides what step to take next.

items.title: Trump vows tariffs on eight European countries over Greenland stand-off
items.description: Donald Trump announces the escalating tariffs for Denmark, Norway, Sweden, France, Germany, the United Kingdom, the Netherlands and Finland as a row over Greenland continues.

items.title: Putin's 'worst-case scenario' could be realised in Iran regime change
items.description: Tehran is the epicentre of the nightly protests shaking Iran's regime, but the reverberations are being felt loud and clear in Moscow, too.

items.title: 'Extremely wild weather': NSW coast battles heavy rainfall, flash flooding
items.description: The State Emergency Service responds to more than 1,400 incidents and 20 flood rescues, most of which involve people driving through floodwaters.

items.title: None in family history, yet 'cancer still found us in the worst way'
items.description: Abbey was "joy on two legs" and now she's gone, another lost to brain cancer. Somehow her family must carry on as the fight for more funding to bring this horror disease to an end continues.

items.title: The CIA orchestrated an Iranian coup seven decades ago. It still haunts the US
items.description: Protesters are urging US President Donald Trump to help dismantle Iran's theocracy. If he answers the call, it won't be the first time the US has toppled an Iranian government.

items.title: BHP popular with investors as CBA loses its shine in market
items.description: The year is barely underway but already there's a power struggle between our biggest corporations as they fight it out for line honours.

items.title: As a bushfire raged around them, a volunteer brigade made a plan to survive
items.description: The volunteer brigade from Terip Terip went through "hell" and back, narrowly escaping death while fighting to save their own community and those nearby.

items.title: On the world's largest hospital ship volunteers give people a chance at a better life
items.description: On the largest civilian hospital ship in the world, Australian volunteers provide life-changing healthcare that is transforming lives.

items.title: How to calculate board or rent if you have adult children at home
items.description: Experts on the benefit of charging board and expenses if you’re sharing a home with young adults, and how to calculate it.

items.title: Interpreter makes more than 200 errors in Supreme Court trial
items.description: A Victorian Supreme Court trial is forging ahead with amended transcripts after an interpreter made more than 200 translation errors during a key witness' evidence.

items.title: Sharks seek sea change as ocean temperatures rise
items.description: Several shark species are on the move as waters warm along Australia’s east coast. Here's how climate change is affecting the range of three major species.

items.title: Tourists triple the population of this coastal town, and some never leave
items.description: Former professional surfers and board makers have chosen this small coastal paradise as their home, but with smaller waves, what makes it so special?

items.title: Australian woman attends 'prison' amid Chinese weight loss craze
items.description: Camps offering intensive weight loss programs are on the rise in China as the country faces skyrocketing obesity rates.

items.title: Artist's paintings sprouted from dry red dust of Bourke's harshest years
items.description: Jenny and Steve Greentree's young family faced losing everything in the millennium drought. Twenty years on, their thriving art gallery has helped to put Bourke on the map.

items.title: Mum of three flew coop to rediscover herself in outback Queensland
items.description: Sam wanted to "rediscover who she was in my 20s", so she left her family and life behind to chase an outback adventure.

items.title: New year, new you? Ha. Let’s play… HARD!
items.description: Wow, you really don't quit. Let's see how poorly you perform this week.

items.title: Inside Canberra childcare's dangerous staffing failures
items.description: Staffing and supervision gaps at Canberra childcare centres have resulted in children sustaining broken bones and dislocated jaws, regulator files have revealed, prompting the ACT government to promise change.

items.title: 'Back to my best': Kerr's comeback continues with FA Cup double
items.description: Sam Kerr declares she is approaching her best form after scoring twice for Chelsea in a Women's FA Cup victory over Crystal Palace.

items.title: Aussie narrowly misses slice of bobsled history ahead of Milan-Cortina tilt
items.description: Sledder Bree Walker finishes second in the overall monobob standings after winning silver in Altenberg, Germany, on another day of success for Aussie Winter Olympic hopes.

items.title: Crashes thwart Australian team on day one of women's Tour Down Under
items.description: The Australian Liv AlUla Jayco team is out to rescue its women's Tour Down Under campaign after a painful start in Saturday's opening stage.

items.title: Why Djokovic won't be burdened by grand slam record chase
items.description: After two years stuck one shy of the all-time grand slam titles record, Novak Djokovic believes the Australian Open is as good a place as any to make his greatest piece of history.

items.title: Greenland is not for sale: Thousands take to the streets of Denmark
items.description: Chanting "Greenland is not for sale" and carrying banners saying "Hands off Greenland", thousands of people have marched in Denmark, responding to US President Donald Trump's ambitions to acquire the Arctic island.

items.title: The flying butcher brings local beef back to Katherine after 25 years
items.description: After surviving a serious helicopter crash, this multi-skilled butcher becomes the face of a paddock-to-plate business in rural Australia.

items.title: Calls for NSW police to end protest restrictions before Australia Day rallies
items.description: Lawyers, human rights advocates and civil libertarians are urging the NSW Police Commissioner not to extend a ban on authorised public assemblies as January 26 approaches.
